intro: Nototriche erinacea, commonly known as the hairy nototriche, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Nototriche erinacea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its hairy texture and unique floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
